      AAdds a user (assuming they have permission) to a permissionable object.

      Target API Endpoint: /consumer/permissions/add

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      the account id of the user SirqulKeys.permissionableType
      the permissionable type Enums.PermissionableType SirqulKeys.permissionableId
      the id of the permissionable object SirqulKeys.read
      the read permission of the users/groups SirqulKeys.write
      the write permission of the users/groups SirqulKeys.delete
      the delete permission of the users/groups SirqulKeys.add
      the add permission of the users/groups SirqulKeys.connectionIds
      list of connection ids (NOT the account ids) SirqulKeys.connectionGroupIds
      list of connection group ids (these are groups made by the user) SirqulKeys.includeFriendGroup

    • Method Detail

      • addConnectionsToPermissionable

        public void addConnectionsToPermissionable(Map<String,Object> params,
                                  ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        AAdds a user (assuming they have permission) to a permissionable object.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/permissions/add

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableType
          the permissionable type Enums.PermissionableType
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableId
          the id of the permissionable object
        • SirqulKeys.read
          the read permission of the users/groups
        • SirqulKeys.write
          the write permission of the users/groups
        • SirqulKeys.delete
          the delete permission of the users/groups
        • SirqulKeys.add
          the add permission of the users/groups
        • SirqulKeys.connectionIds
          list of connection ids (NOT the account ids)
        • SirqulKeys.connectionGroupIds
          list of connection group ids (these are groups made by the user)
        • SirqulKeys.includeFriendGroup
          flag to determines whether to include the built-in "friends" group
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        UserPermissionsApiBase.addConnectionsToPermissionable

      • removeUsersFromPermissionable

        public void removeUsersFromPermissionable(Map<String,Object> params,
                                 ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Used to remove someone (assuming they have permission) from a permissionable object

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/permissions/remove

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableType
          the permissionable type Enums.PermissionableType
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableId
          the id of the permissionable object
        • SirqulKeys.connectionIds
          a list of connection ids (NOT the account ids)
        • SirqulKeys.connectionGroupIds
          a list of connection group ids (these are groups made by the user)
        • SirqulKeys.removeFriendGroup
          flag to determine whether to remove the built-in "friends" group
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        UserPermissionsApiBase.removeUsersFromPermissionable
